SEARCH
Modul htl.steyr.javafx_minesweeper_tplatzer
Package htl.steyr.javafx_minesweeper_tplatzer.model

Klasse Cell

java.lang.Object
htl.steyr.javafx_minesweeper_tplatzer.model.Cell
public class Cell extends Object
Represents a single cell in the Minesweeper game grid.

A cell can either be a bomb or a regular cell and supports various states such as flagged, revealed, or questioned. Each cell interacts with a GameController to manage game logic such as revealing cells, toggling flags, and checking win conditions.

  • Konstruktordetails

    • Cell

      public Cell(String style, boolean isBomb, GameController gameController, int row, int column)
      Constructs a new Cell with the specified parameters.

      Initializes the cell's state, visual style, position, and graphical representation. Attaches mouse click handlers to manage primary (left-click) and secondary (right-click) actions.

      Parameter:
      style - The visual style of the cell (e.g., "retro", "modern").
      isBomb - true if the cell contains a bomb, false otherwise.
      gameController - The GameController managing this cell.
      row - The row index of the cell in the game grid.
      column - The column index of the cell in the game grid.

  • Methodendetails

    • reveal

      public void reveal(boolean suppressEndGame)
      Reveals the cell and updates its state and appearance based on its content.

      If the cell is flagged or already revealed, the method does nothing. Otherwise:

      • If the cell is a bomb, it triggers the game's end unless suppression is enabled.
      • If the cell has adjacent bombs, it displays the count of adjacent bombs.
      • If the cell has no adjacent bombs, it recursively reveals all neighboring cells.
      Parameter:
      suppressEndGame - true to prevent the game from ending if the cell contains a bomb, false to allow the game to end normally.

    • silentBombReveal

      public void silentBombReveal(boolean suppressEndGame)
      Reveals the cell as a bomb without triggering end-game logic by default.

      This method updates the cell's appearance to indicate that it contains a bomb. If suppressEndGame is true, it applies an additional style to visually distinguish the revealed bomb from others.

      Parameter:
      suppressEndGame - true to apply a distinct style for bomb-revealed cells without ending the game, false otherwise.

    • setIconForButton

      public void setIconForButton(String icon)
      Sets an icon for the cell's button using the specified image file.

      This method loads an image based on the provided icon name and applies it to the button. The image is dynamically resized to maintain its aspect ratio and fit within the button's dimensions.

      Parameter:
      icon - The name of the icon file (without the file extension) to be displayed on the button. The file should be located in the path: /<style>/img/<icon>.png.
      Löst aus:
      NullPointerException - if the icon file cannot be found in the specified path.
